intro: Bonjeanea hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy bonjeanea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Bonjeanea hirsuta is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and woodland areas.
